snippet: The chancellor of Santa Monica College in California says that the legality of a program that would charge more for popular courses is still in question.
abstract: Jack Scott, chancellor of California's community college system, asks Santa Monica College to delay its plan to institute a two-tiered tuition system, saying the legality of the program is still in question; Santa Monica has proposed premium pricing for popular classes.
lead_paragraph: The chancellor of Santa Monica College in California says that the legality of a program that would charge more for popular courses is still in question.

headline.seo: Santa Monica College Asked to Hold Off on Tuition Plan
headline.main: Chancellor Asks California Community College to Hold Off on 2-Tier Tuition Plan
headline.print_headline: Chancellor Asks California Community College to Hold Off on 2-Tier Tuition Plan
